pages.text: You remember the blocks that shielded your precious gemstones from external influences? Those black and white materials look really pretty, so you designed some decoration blocks out of them.$(br2)Maybe they also absorbed some of the magical properties of the gemstones themselves?$(br)Who knows.
Applying heat to basalt emphasizes their dark and bright textures even more. Smelting also results in a much cleaner texture, which is perfect for building.

pages.title: Polished Basalt Blocks
pages.text: The dark gray basalt surrounding the geodes is a wonderful contrast to the bright hues of the calcite.$(br)When smelted, it almost turns black.

pages.title: Polished Calcite Blocks
pages.text: The bright white of calcite may be the brightest natural color you've stumbled across.$(br)It looks very clean and radiates dignity.
By applying heat, all blocks can be converted back to their polished versions again.

pages.title: Tuff Blocks
pages.text: While you were searching for geodes underground, you also stumbled across tuff.$(br)After you've collected a whole bunch of it, it can't hurt to make some additional shapes out of this material, too.
